intro: Ardisiandra orientalis var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ardisiandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Solanaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including regions of Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, contributing to its propagation in its natural habitat.
